intro: Costularia chamaedendron, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a rough texture, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Costularia chamaedendron is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
